page.title: 19Ringmer Sayings and Rhymes
page.content: {If}you see a rook sitting on dead wood it is a sign of rain. {Oak}before the ash we're sure to have a splash; Ash before the oak we're sure to have a soak. (meaning a fine summer if the oak tree comes into leaf before the ash; a wet summer if the ash comes into leaf first.) { {Don't}cast a clout 'til May is out. {Rain}before seven, fine by eleven . {Sussex}born, Sussex bred, Strong in the arm, weak in the head. {Friday}night's dream on Saturday told, Is sure to come true however old. {Sussex}won't be druv. (meaning people of Sussex cannot be made to do what they do not want to do) { Sussex Sheep Counting Rhyme One-err-um, Two-err-um, Dick-err-um, Shoo-eer-um, Shetherum, Shatherum, Wineberry, Wagtail, Tarry-Diddle, Den.
